meanings.definition: A small space or gap between objects or parts.
meanings.sent1: The ant crawled through the interstice in the wall.
meanings.sent2: The sunlight shone through the interstice in the curtains.
meanings.sent3: The interstice between the two puzzle pieces made it tricky to fit them together.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter filled every interstice of the room, bringing joy to all.
meanings.sent5: The interstice in the fence allowed the cat to slip through easily.

meanings.definition: An intervening space, especially a very small one.
meanings.sent1: He noticed a tiny interstice between the pages of the book.
meanings.sent2: The spider web glistened in the interstice of the branches.
meanings.sent3: The interstice in the conversation made everyone pause and think.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to stand still in the interstice before the clock struck midnight.
meanings.sent5: The interstice in the crowd allowed her to catch a glimpse of the stage.
